intro: Scleranthus paradoxus, commonly known as the paradoxical thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The plant has distinctive serrated leaves and produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and the presence of glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. Scleranthus paradoxus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
